intro: Meconopsis zhongdianensis, commonly known as the Zhongdian meconopsis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments and is adapted to cold, harsh climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
